# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the code for the `wrap_string` function:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    for word in lines
        line = wrapped_text * (word[1] == '\n' ? "\n" : "") * word
        if length(line) > text_width
            while length(line) > text_width && line[end] != '\n'
                wrapped_text = wrapped_text * line
                line = lines[findnext(w -> w == '\n' || isempty(w), lines[findprev(w -> w == '\n' || isempty(w), end + 1):end])]
            end
        end
        wrapped_text = wrapped_text * line
    end
    return wrapped_text
end
```

Here's an example usage:

```julia
using Base.Test
@test wrap_string("This is a sentence that has more than 10 characters per line, and it should be wrapped accordingly.") == "This is a sentence that\nhas more than 10 characters\nper line, and it should\nbe wrapped accordingly."
```
